abstract:
We integrate the human movement and healthcare resource data to identify cities with high vulnerability towards the 2019-nCoV epidemic with respect to available health resources. The results inform public health responses in multiple ways.
Competing Interest Statement
The authors have declared no competing interest.
affiliations: National Natural Science Foundation of China (71621002, and 71972164), and Chinese Academy of Sciences (ZDRW-XH-2017-3)
author: Kaichen Tang; Dirk Pfeiffer; Jianan Yang; Daniel Dajun Zeng; zhidong cao; Hanchu Zhou; Qingpeng Zhang
title: Healthcare-resource-adjusted vulnerabilities towards the 2019-nCoV epidemic across China

award-group.funding-source: National Natural Science Foundation of China

funding.funding-statement: This work was supported in part by grants from the Ministry of Science and Technology (2016QY02D0305), National Natural Science Foundation of China (71621002, and 71972164), and Chinese Academy of Sciences (ZDRW-XH-2017-3)
